snippet: The earnings flowed from a strategy of focusing on higher-margin businesses, fast-growing overseas markets and aggressive cost cutting.
abstract: IBM reports strong earnings from a strategy of focusing on higher-margin businesses, fast-growing overseas markets and aggressive cost cutting; second-quarter income was $3.9 billion, or $3.51 per share, up 6 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue was $25.8 billion, down 3 percent.
lead_paragraph: The earnings flowed from a strategy of focusing on higher-margin businesses, fast-growing overseas markets and aggressive cost cutting.

headline.print_headline: I.B.M. Posts a Strong Quarter Despite Softness in Revenue
